title: In conversation with Jia Tolentino – podcast
text:
Jia Tolentino, described as one of the world’s greatest young essayists, discusses how the age of the internet has fundamentally changed who we are. Plus: Lisa O’Carroll on the Irish border

Jia Tolentino is famed not just for her writing, but the breadth of subjects she tackles. From casual drug-taking to mainstream feminism, she has been hailed as one of the best writers of her generation.

Brought up in a Southern Baptist community in Texas, she appeared on a reality TV show when she was a teenager and worked for the Peace Corps in Kyrgyzstan before becoming a staff writer at the New Yorker. She discusses her first book, a collection of essays that look at self-delusion in the age of the internet, with Rachel Humphreys.

And: Lisa O’Carroll on Brexit and the Irish border
